latest.title: Notice of AGM
latest.content:
27 Jan 2026 07:00
RNS Number : 4210Q
Critical Metals PLC
27 January 2026
Critical Metals plc / EPIC: CRTM / Market: Main Market
27 January 2026
Critical Metals plc
("Critical Metals" or the "Company")
Notice of AGM
Critical Metals plc, a mining company established to acquire mining opportunities in the critical and strategic metals sector, currently developing the Molulu Copper/ Cobalt Project in the Democratic Republic of Congo ("DRC"), is pleased to inform shareholders of its Annual General Meeting which will be held at 10 am on 19 February 2026 at the offices of Hill Dickinson LLP, The Broadgate Tower, 20 Primrose Street, London, EC2A 2EW.
A copy of the Annual Report and Accounts for the year ended 30 June 2025, AGM Notice and Proxy Form are available by visiting the Company's website:
https://www.criticalmetals.co.uk/investors/corporate-documents
For further information contact:
Critical Metals plc
Danilo Lange, CEO
c/o
critical@stbridespartners.co.uk
St Brides Partners Ltd
Financial PR
Ana Ribeiro/Charlotte Page
critical@stbridespartners.co.uk
About Critical Metals
London-listed Critical Metals plc is focused on identifying low CAPEX and OPEX brown-field projects with near-term production and cash-flow, concentrating on minerals that have strategic importance to future global economic growth. In line with this, and with an off-take partner already in place, the Company is currently focused on recommencing production at the formerly producing Molulu Copper/Cobalt Project in the Katangan Copperbelt in Democratic Republic of Congo ('DRC').
This information is provided by RNS, the news service of the London Stock Exchange. RNS is approved by the Financial Conduct Authority to act as a Primary Information Provider in the United Kingdom. latest.title: Issue of Convertible Loan Notes
latest.content:
31 Dec 2025 07:00
RNS Number : 2055N
Critical Metals PLC
31 December 2025
Critical Metals plc / EPIC: CRTM / Market: Main Market
31 December 2025
Critical Metals plc
("Critical Metals" or the "Company")
Issue of Convertible Loan Notes with related party participation to raise £2.1 million
Critical Metals plc (LSE:CRTM), a mining company established to acquire mining opportunities in the critical and strategic metals sector, currently developing the Molulu Copper/Cobalt Project ("Molulu") in the Democratic Republic of Congo, announces that it has issued a £2,100,000 convertible loan instrument ("CLN Instrument"). On 30 December 2025 NIU Invest SE ("NIU"), the majority shareholder in the Company, has agreed to subscribe to the full £2,100,000 of convertible loan notes ("CLNs") issued under the CLN Instrument at par.
The main terms of the CLNs are as follows:
·
Mature in 18 month;
·
Interest at 10% per annum, payable on maturity;
·
Are convertible into ordinary shares of the company at a conversion price of 10.25 per Ordinary Share of £0.0005 each in the capital of the Company ("Ordinary Shares"), which is equal to the 15 day volume weighted average share price and represents a 5.7% discount to the closing price on 29 December 2025; and
·
May be converted into shares at NIU's discretion at any time subject to certain restrictions and if not converted will be repayable at the end of the term.
The issue of the CLNs to NIU is a material related party transaction for the purposes of DTR 7.3.6 due to NIU's shareholding in the Company representing 74.04% of the issued Ordinary Shares.
The funds raised under the CLN will be used to carry out business development as the Company explores acquisition opportunities in the mining sector, fund exploration activities at Molulu and for general working capital.
Danilo Lange, Interim CEO of Critical Metals said:
"The £2.1 million raised through the CLN Instrument will enable the Company to start delivering on its strategy, funding exploration work at Molulu while also supporting the identification of potential acquisitions across the sector."
**ENDS**
For further information on the Company please visit
www.criticalmetals.co.uk
or contact:
Critical Metals plc
Danilo Lange, CEO
critical@stbridespartners.co.uk
St Brides Partners Ltd
Financial PR
Ana Ribeiro/Charlotte Page
critical@stbridespartners.co.uk
About Critical Metals
London listed Critical Metals plc is focused on identifying low CAPEX and OPEX brown-field projects with near-term production and cash-flow, concentrating on minerals that have strategic importance to future global economic growth. In line with this, and with an off-take partner already in place, the Company is currently focused on recommencing production at the formerly producing Molulu Copper/Cobalt Project in the Katangan Copperbelt in Democratic Republic of Congo ('DRC').

latest.title: Board Changes
latest.content:
16 Dec 2025 07:00
RNS Number : 6579L
Critical Metals PLC
16 December 2025
Critical Metals plc / EPIC: CRTM / Market: Main Market
16 December 2025
Critical Metals Plc
("Critical Metals" or the "Company")
Board Changes
Critical Metals plc (
LSE:CRTM)
, a mining company established to acquire mining opportunities in the critical and strategic metals sector, currently developing the Molulu Copper/Cobalt Project ("Molulu") in the Democratic Republic of Congo, announces two changes to the Board of Directors.
Mr Ali Farid Khwaja has resigned as Chief Executive Officer ("CEO"), effective immediately for personal reasons and the Board would like to thank him for his significant contributions during his short tenure as CEO, particularly in guiding the Company through a critical phase of restructuring. We wish him well for the future. The operations, financial plans and strategy remain unchanged. The Board is confident that the senior management can deliver the strategy and have the oversite and executive capability.
The Board has appointed Mr Danilo Lange as interim CEO of the Company while the Board carries out an executive search process in the coming months. The Board is confident that Mr Lange has the skills and experience to continue the company's development. Mr Lange is an experienced international executive with over 25 years of leadership experience across mining, consumer goods, and marketing sectors. He has a proven history in corporate turnaround, business expansion, and cross-cultural team management in Europe, the Middle East, and Eastern Europe. He previously served as CEO of a NASDAQ OMEX listed gold producer and exploration company in Sweden. He has held senior management roles at Serviceplan Group, Red Bull, and Yahoo! and is fluent in six languages, including French. He holds a Master of Science from the University of Applied Science & Economics, Germany.
**ENDS**
Critical Metals plc
critical@stbridespartners.co.uk
St Brides Partners Ltd
Financial PR
Ana Ribeiro / Charlotte Page
critical@stbridespartners.co.uk
About Critical Metals
Critical Metals plc (LSE: CRTM)
is
a mining company established to acquire and invest in brownfield mining projects with low-CAPEX and OPEX, close to production, in the critical and strategic metals sector. The Company
is focused in developing the formerly producing Molulu Copper/Cobalt Project in the Katangan Copperbelt in Democratic Republic of Congo. Its shares are admitted to the Official List and trade on the Main Market of the LSE.
This information is provided by RNS, the news service of the London Stock Exchange. RNS is approved by the Financial Conduct Authority to act as a Primary Information Provider in the United Kingdom. company_30s.what_they_do: CRTM Ltd operates as a small‑cap listed on the AIM, though its specific business focus remains opaque.
company_30s.why_they_matter: The company has attracted attention due to a series of capital‑raising events and a dominant shareholder stake, making its stock a potential play for high‑risk traders.
company_30s.current_state: CRTM is currently pre‑revenue, heavily diluting shareholders through multiple share issues and convertible debt.

rns_narrative: Capital‑raising whirlwind: In the past year CRTM has announced a share offer, completed a subscription, and issued convertible loan notes. The company also extended the repayment date for its CLN, signalling a need for liquidity. These events have injected fresh cash but at the cost of a heavily diluted equity base.

Governance shuffle: Board changes were announced in mid‑December, followed by a notice of AGM in late January 2026. The AGM will likely be a platform to discuss future strategy, potential new directors, and any planned share issuances. The timing suggests the company is preparing for a new phase of operations or a restructuring.

Ownership concentration: NIU Invest has increased its stake to 69.62% in September 2025, making it the controlling shareholder. This concentration raises concerns about corporate governance, but also indicates a committed investor willing to back the company through subsequent funding rounds. The company’s recent suspension of Critical Metals Plc hints at a potential divestment or partnership that could influence future capital structure.

crowd_tape.dominant_theme: The community remains silent, with no posts tracked. There is no consensus, but the absence of chatter suggests a lack of interest or conviction among retail investors.
crowd_tape.bull_narrative: Some bulls see the capital‑raising as a chance for the company to accelerate a turnaround. They point to the controlling stake and the potential for a strategic pivot to a higher‑growth sector.
crowd_tape.bear_narrative: Bears worry about the sheer dilution, lack of revenue, and the company’s repeated reliance on debt. They argue that without a clear product or earnings, the stock is a speculative trap.
crowd_tape.sentiment_shift: There was no notable shift in sentiment; the story has been quiet from the start.

whats_happening_now.attention_check: Google Trends shows a flat line at zero interest, and social media volume is zero. The story has never gained traction and is essentially oxygen‑deprived. Without new buzz, the market is unlikely to move.

near_term_catalysts: Potential Q1 results or a revenue announcement: If the company can report its first revenue or a positive earnings surprise, that would be a make‑or‑break moment for bulls.
expect_next.watch_for: Watch for any director selling signals, further dilution through a placement, or a sudden drop in share price. Any hint of a failed funding round would be a red flag.
expect_next.timing_regime: The APEX score suggests the company is in an early, low‑confidence stage. This means the window for entry is narrow, and any move will be highly speculative.
recent_past_catalysts: AGM on 27 January 2026: A potential strategy update, new board appointments, or a vote on additional capital could be the first real catalyst for a price move.

buy_vs_sell.bull_case: If CRTM can convert the recent capital inflows into a tangible product or service line that starts generating revenue, and if the controlling shareholder remains committed, the stock could rally. A successful pivot to a high‑growth niche would validate the buy.
buy_vs_sell.bear_case: The company is heavily diluted, has no revenue history, and relies on debt and further equity raises for survival. The controlling stake could also withdraw support, leading to a collapse. The lack of market interest and flat trends signal a weak demand side.
buy_vs_sell.risk_reward: High risk with limited upside; the potential reward is modest compared to the probability of a total write‑off.

playbook.if_bullish: Take a tiny position (2–3% of capital) only after a clear revenue signal or a positive AGM outcome. Set a stop at 8p below the issuance price to protect against a sudden collapse.
playbook.if_watching: Hold off until the AGM or a revenue announcement. If the company reports positive earnings or a strategic partnership, consider buying on a dip.
playbook.if_passing: Stay out for now. The story lacks momentum, the price is flat, and the dilution risk is high. Better opportunities exist elsewhere.

ai_insights.bottom_line: Pass—no traction, high dilution, and no clear catalyst. The story is oxygen‑deprived and unlikely to move without a major surprise.

Current setup looks like CROWDED with an APEX score of 40/100. Historically there have been 1 rallies (avg. 463%); the position is now +463.4%. Practical take: this is interesting but unconfirmed — wait for an AI snapshot or clear confirmation before committing size.

bear_case: No immediate red flags, but keep stops tight
commentary.timing_translation: Late-stage rally — trim into strength and tighten risk.
